articles.title: How an altered protein and fussy neurons conspire to cause microcephaly
summary: - Microcephaly is caused by mutations in the SASS6 gene, which encodes a protein essential for centriole assembly during cell division.
- Mutations in SASS6 can lead to abnormal centriole formation, particularly affecting neuron development and resulting in microcephaly.
- Consanguineous marriages increase the risk of inheriting mutated SASS6 genes, contributing to a higher incidence of microcephaly.

articles.title: Students of classes 1 to 10 in government and aided schools to have spoken English classes
summary: - The Department of School Education and Literacy (DSEL) will introduce spoken English classes for students in government and aided schools from classes 1 to 10, starting in the 2024-25 academic year.
- The classes will be conducted every Saturday for 40 minutes, focusing on activities like conversation, role-playing, and storytelling to improve fluency.
- The DSEL aims to improve English proficiency among students, particularly those in rural areas, to enhance their future education and competitive exam performance.

articles.title: Apple loses bid to appeal order allowing consumer antitrust class action
summary: - Apple's appeal to block a class action lawsuit alleging iPhone app price manipulation was rejected by the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals.
- The lawsuit, which accuses Apple of antitrust violations, will proceed, potentially leading to a trial in 2026.
- The decision allows a class of consumers who spent at least $10 on Apple apps since 2008 to pursue damages.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un says North Korea will never give up space reconnaissance programme
summary: - Kim Jong Un claims space reconnaissance is essential for North Korea's defense and sovereignty, vowing to continue the program.
- North Korea's recent attempted satellite launch failed due to a booster explosion.
- Kim criticized South Korea's condemnation of the launch, accusing them of provoking tensions and playing with fire.

articles.title: Rupee falls nine paise to 83.27 against U.S. dollar in early trade
summary: - The Indian Rupee depreciated by nine paise to 83.27 against the US dollar on May 29, influenced by a negative trend in domestic equities and rising crude oil prices.
- The weakening of the Rupee was attributed to subdued sentiment in the Indian equity market and a strengthening of the US dollar in the global market.
- The dollar index rose by 0.11%, while Brent crude futures advanced by 0.21%, further contributing to the Rupee's depreciation.

articles.title: India General Elections 2024 LIVE Updates: PM Modi, Rahul Gandhi, Naveen Patnaik to campaign in Odisha
summary: - The final phase of India's 2024 General Elections will take place on June 1st, with key political figures campaigning in Odisha.
- The Election Commission of India has transferred three police officers in West Bengal to non-election related posts.
- The seventh and final phase of the Lok Sabha election will be held across 57 constituencies in West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh, and Himachal Pradesh.

articles.title: Prosecutor says Trump tried 'to hoodwink voters' while defence attacks key witness in last arguments
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman pledges to donate most of his wealth
summary: - OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has joined the Giving Pledge, committing to donate over half his wealth to philanthropy.
- Altman plans to focus his giving on technology that promotes abundance and benefits humanity.
- The Giving Pledge, founded by Bill Gates, Melinda French Gates, and Warren Buffett, encourages wealthy individuals to donate a majority of their wealth to charitable causes.

articles.title: Ex-OpenAI executive Jan Leike joins Amazon-backed Anthropic
AI darling Nvidia's market value surges closer to Apple
summary: - Nvidia's stock surged to a record high, pushing its market value close to Apple's, driven by strong AI chip demand and positive revenue forecasts.
- Investors are betting on Nvidia's growth trajectory in the AI market, with its stock price more than doubling this year.
- Apple's stock has underperformed other Big Tech companies due to weak iPhone demand and slower adoption of generative AI compared to rivals.

articles.title: Top Kerala news developments today
summary: - The trial allotment for admission to Plus 1 class in Kerala will be published today.
- The Justice Hariprasad Commission will hold its first sitting today to investigate the death of a student allegedly due to ragging.
- The Kerala High Court will hear petitions challenging summons issued by the Enforcement Directorate regarding KIIFB's masala bonds.

articles.title: Top EU data regulator says tech giants working closely on AI compliance
summary: - Leading tech companies are actively engaging with EU regulators to ensure AI compliance with data protection rules.
- The Irish Data Protection Commission, the lead regulator for several tech giants, has broad powers to enforce data privacy and could force changes to AI models.
-  AI operators must address concerns about data rights, accuracy, and the legal basis for using personal data to train models.

articles.title: U.S. court to hear challenges to potential TikTok ban in September
summary: - A U.S. appeals court will hear legal challenges to a new law requiring ByteDance to divest TikTok's U.S. assets in September.
- The law, signed by President Biden in April, gives ByteDance until January 19 to sell TikTok or face a ban.
- TikTok, ByteDance, and a group of content creators are challenging the law, arguing it violates their First Amendment rights and has a significant impact on American life.

articles.title: Heatwave alert: Extreme heatwave hits northern and central India, temperatures soar above 50°C in Churu and Sirsa
summary: - Northern and central India experienced extreme heatwave conditions on May 28, with temperatures exceeding 50 degrees Celsius in Churu and Sirsa.
- The IMD predicts a respite from the heatwave starting May 30 due to an incoming western disturbance and moist winds from the Arabian Sea and Bay of Bengal.
- The highest-ever maximum temperatures were recorded in several cities, including Agra, Dehri, Hamirpur, Jhansi, Narnaul, and Varanasi.

articles.title: U.S. condemns loss of life, but says no policy changes after civilian deaths in Israeli strike
summary: - The U.S. condemned the civilian deaths in an Israeli airstrike in Rafah but stated no policy changes are planned, citing Israel's avoidance of a full-scale ground invasion.

- While acknowledging the incident's "heartbreaking" nature, the U.S. continues to provide security assistance to Israel and emphasizes its ongoing monitoring of Israeli investigations into the strike.
- The U.S. expressed concern about the challenges of military operations in densely populated areas and emphasized the need for Israel to protect innocent lives.
